info.title: Diablo Media Affiliate API V1
info.description:
Welcome to the documentation for our Affiliate API. We've designed this API to give you, the affiliate, programmatic access to all of the functionality of our affiliate interface. In other words, we dog-food this API as it's the same API that we use in our [Affiliate User Interface](https://affiliate.diablomedia.com). Anything that we do in our Affiliate UI, you can do with this API with your own integrations.

After the "Authentication" section below, each group is broken out to the different types of "resources" that we provide through the API. Generally each resource type has a "Collection" endpoint and a "Resource" endpoint. Collections will be a list of objects of that type, and a Resource is a single object of that type. Browse to the section that you're interested in to see sample requests and responses. The resource types in a Collection response typically contain less properties than the corresponding Resource response, to reduce how much data is returned over the wire for each request. The sample responses for each resource type indicate which properties we return for the Collection vs. Resource requests for an object.

This is a REST JSON API, so all requests must send the `Accept: application/json` header in order for the API to respond with an expected response (the "Try Now" functionality of this documentation should do this for sample requests).

The responses are formatted to meet the [HAL](http://stateless.co/hal_specification.html) specification but should be readable/parseable by any JSON parser.

If you find any inconsistencies between this documentation and the API itself, please open an issue at [Github](https://github.com/diablomedia/pubapi_docs) or contact us [directly](mailto:info@diablomedia.com). We're always open to changes/improvements that will make this API more useful to our affiliates, so please let us know how we can make it better.

# Versioning

This is the first release of our API, therefore we've used the "v1" tag on the URL. If we ever need to make breaking changes to the API (that would break any integration that our affiliates have already created) we'll change the URL for the api to the next major version ("v2" would be next). You may continue to use the older version of the API for as long as you'd like (we'll probably retire older versions at some point, but we'll work with you to be sure that we don't break any integrations that you've setup on older versions of the API).

# Authentication

You must have an API token to make requests against this API. Use our [affiliate interface](https://affiliate.diablomedia.com) to generate an API token (you can do this in the "API Access" sub-section of the "User Preferences" section). Once you have a token, you can authenticate to the API in one of two ways:

## Authorization Header

This method is the most secure, because it keeps your token out of the request's query string (which can end up in proxy logs). Add your token to the `Authorization Header` as demonstrated below (replace xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx with your token):

`Authorization: Bearer xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`

In the examples in this documentation we use "pleaseinsertyourtokenhere" as the token placeholder. If you use the "Try" functionality of these docs, you'll need to replace that text with your actual token to get a real response from our server.

## Query String Parameter

If the header option isn't possible with your integration, this method is supported as well. Simply add your token as a query string parameter to the request's URL (replace xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx with your token):

`{$$.env.host}/{$$.env.version}/campaigns?publisher_id=10000&access_token=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`

## Account Access

Tokens are assigned to a User Account (also called a Contact), which means that a single account may have access to several Publisher accounts in our system if your Contact record is linked to more than one Publisher. Because of this, most of the API requests require that a `publisher_id` query string parameter is added to the request so that we know which Publisher account the request is for. In the example requests below we've denoted if the `publisher_id` query string parameter is required or not (if it's not passed for these requests, you'll receive a `401` error response).

get.description: Returns a full record for the campaign specified in the URL.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: ID of the Campaign in form of an integer

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

get.description: This endpoint will return a ZIP file of all of this campaign's creatives.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: ID of the Campaign to export creatives for

get.description: This endpoint will redirect the request to the suppression file download location for this campaign (if applicable), and log the download in our system.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: ID of the Campaign to download the suppression file for

get.description: Paged listing of all campaigns available, can be filtered by various campaign properties.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The slug of a category (or categories separated by commas) to filter the results by

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The "code" of a country (or several countries, separated by commas) to filter by

parameters.name: payout_type
parameters.description: Filter the results by campaign payout type, separate several options with a comma

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the results by this field, prepend with a dash (-) to reverse the sort direction

parameters.name: traffic_type
parameters.description: Filter the results by campaign traffic type slug (separate by a comma to filter by multiple traffic types)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter the results by campaign type, separate several options with a comma

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Filter the results by visibility

get.description:
A "Campaign Approval" is an approval request made against a specific campaign for a specific publisher account. Approval Requests are sent to our affiliate team where they can be approved or denied. Only one outstanding approval request can exist for a specific campaign/publisher combination.

Use this endpoint to view existing approval requests that you've made.

parameters.name: approval_id
parameters.description: ID of the approval to fetch

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

get.description: List all campaign approval requests for this publisher.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

post.description: If you are not yet authorized to run a campaign (the campaign's `approval_status` is not "approved"), you can make an approval request for that campaign with this request.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Content type that you want the response to be in (application/json is only accepted format currently)

get.description: We use categories to classify our campaigns and publishers to help us (and you) find campaigns that are a good fit. These categories are used to filter campaigns and can also be assigned to a publisher's "categories" property, showing that the publisher is interested in offers that span those categories.
A "contact" is a user account that is associated to one or many publisher accounts. Access to our system is done through a Contact, which may have access to several publisher accounts.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: ID of the Contact

patch.description:
The following properties of a Contact record can be updated through this API:

* address
* address2
* birthday
* city
* country
* fax
* first_name
* last_name
* messaging
* mobile_phone
* password
* phone
* postal_code
* region

To update a Contact, issue a PATCH request containing a JSON body with the properties that you want to update, as shown in the example.  The `id` property of the JSON request must match the id of your user account.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: ID of the Contact

get.description: This endpoint is provided for consistency, but will only ever return the contact associated with your token.
The country resources are referenced on Campaigns, which signifies which countries the campaign accepts traffic from.

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account your are working as

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: 2 digit ISO code for Country to fetch

get.description: Lists the publisher records that your account has access to.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Search keyword used to filter Publishers

parameters.name: !id
parameters.description: ID (or IDs separated by commas) of Publishers that should be filtered from the result

get.description:
This endpoint will provide grouped summary data based on input parameters you send.  The Summary Report in the UI (including the charts) is powered by this endpoint.

There are a lot of filtering capabilities for this report. Most of the columns returned can be filtered, this is particularly useful for the numeric columns (calls, clicks, leads, etc...). The parameters list for this request show some samples, but here is the full reference for the numeric filtering syntax that we support:

* `>5` - This means "greater than 5"

* `>=10` - This means "greater than or equal to 10"

* `<1000` - This means "less than 1000"

* `<=500` - This means "less than or equal to 500"

* `100><1000` - This means "between 100 and 1000 (inclusive)"

* `!100` - This means "not equal to 100"

* `=10` - This means "exactly equal to 10"

parameters.name: campaign
parameters.description: Filter report data by Campaign id

parameters.name: calls
parameters.description: Filter report data by number of Calls (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: click_through
parameters.description: Filter report data by Click Through range (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: clicks
parameters.description: Filter report data by number of Clicks (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Filter report data by Country (2 digit ISO code)

parameters.name: creative
parameters.description: Filter report data by Creative id

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date of the date range to get summary data for

parameters.name: epc
parameters.description: Filter report data by EPC range (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Which dimension to group the results by

parameters.name: impressions
parameters.description: Filter report data by number of Impressions (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: leads
parameters.description: Filter report data by Leads (can use >, < and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: publisher_id
parameters.description: ID of the Publisher account you are working as

parameters.name: revenue
parameters.description: Filter report data by Revenue range (can use <, > and = to specify ranges)

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: Filter report data by SubId (can use asterisk as wildcard)

parameters.name: sign_up
parameters.description: Filter report data by Sign Up Ratio range (specify as a range of values to include)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Which column to sort results by, can prefix with a dash (-) to reverse sort direction

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date of the date range to get summary data for

created.description: An ISO8601 date when the campaign was created

payout.description: The payout amount for this campaign (dollar amount for CPA/CPC campaigns, percentage for RevShare)

payout_type.description: The payout type of the campaign (CPA, CPC, RevShare)

url.description: URL of the offer's home page

phone_number_limit.description: The limit of static phone numbers this publisher is allowed to have on this campaign (PayPerCall only)

subject_lines.description: Array of approved Email Subject Lines for this campaign

last_upload.description: An ISO8601 date when a new suppression file was last uploaded

last_download.description: An ISO8601 date when the suppression file was last downloaded by this publisher

created.description: ISO8602 date when the creative was created

thumbnail.description: URL to the creative's thumbnail image

url.description: Publisher's URL for this creative (Basic and Banner types only)

sid.description: The sid value that will be attributed to calls made with this phone number

created.description: ISO8602 date when the pixel was created

pixel.description: The content of the pixel (either the URL for "url" types, or the HTML content for "html" types)

version.description: The internal version number of this pixel (incremented when pixel is edited)

global.description: Whether or not the pixel is global (fires for all compatible campaigns)
Whether or not the pixel is global (fires for all compatible campaigns)

created.description: ISO8602 date when the approval was created

response_date.description: ISO8602 date when the approval/denial was recorded

traffic_types.description: The traffic types requested to be ran

test_budget.description: The requested number of test leads or clicks

request_detail.description: Details of how the campaign will be ran

success_criteria.description: How the test will be judged to be successful

custom_creative.description: Does publisher want to use a custom creative?

slug.description: Category's Name to be used in URLs
Traffic Type's Name to be used in URLs

type.description: The type of contact at the company (Executive, Primary, Technical, Accounting, etc...)

version.description: The version number of this record, increments when the record is updated.

password.description: Update/set the password used to login

version.description: The version of the record at the time of retrieval

address2.description: Second line of Contact's Street Address

address.description: First line of Contact's Street Address

has_password.description: Whether or not Contact has a password set

region.description: Region part of Contact's Street Address

created.description: ISO8602 date when the message was created

read.description: Whether or not the message has been read

content.description: The full content of the message (can contain HTML)

version.description: The version of the record at the time of retrieval

created.description: ISO8602 date when the publisher was created

primary_contact_id.description: The "owning" contact record of this Publisher

browser.description: Name of the browser from user's user-agent

created.description: ISO8602 date when the transaction was created

creative.description: Id of the creative used in the transaction

device_type.description: Device type from user's user-agent, example values "Desktop", "Mobile Phone", "Tablet" (not exhaustive)

sid.description: SubId sent by Publisher for this transaction

trx.description: TrxId sent by Publisher for this transaction

impressions.description: Number of impressions for this row

clicks.description: Number of clicks for this row

leads.description: Number of leads for this row

calls.description: Number of calls for this row

revenue.description: Amount of revenue for this row

day.description: Date that this row represents, will only be available if the requested data is grouped by Day

sid.description: SubId that this row represents, will only be available if the requested data is grouped by SubId
